intro: Oxalis brevisepala, commonly known as the short-lobed wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and woodlands. Its foliage contains oxalic acid, which can be toxic if ingested in large quantities. Oxalis brevisepala is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
